alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and southeastern Fayette Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Piney View, or 8 miles southwest of Babcock State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rainelle, Piney View, Stanaford, Meadow Bridge and Thurmond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh
